message_1:
The monthly rainfall data of a particular city for the past 10 years is given below. Use time series analysis to determine the average monthly rainfall in the city.

* January: 75 mm
* February: 60 mm
* March: 80 mm
* April: 120 mm
* May: 150 mm
* June: 180 mm
* July: 200 mm
* August: 220 mm
* September: 190 mm
* October: 140 mm
* November: 90 mm
* December: 80 mm
message_2:
To determine the average monthly rainfall in the city, we will add up the rainfall for each month and then divide by the total number of months (12).

Average monthly rainfall = (Total rainfall for all months) / (Number of months)

Total rainfall for all months = 75 mm (January) + 60 mm (February) + 80 mm (March) + 120 mm (April) + 150 mm (May) + 180 mm (June) + 200 mm (July) + 220 mm (August) + 190 mm (September) + 140 mm (October) + 90 mm (November) + 80 mm (December)

Total rainfall for all months = 75 + 60 + 80 + 120 + 150 + 180 + 200 + 220 + 190 + 140 + 90 + 80
Total rainfall for all months = 1495 mm

Number of months = 12

Average monthly rainfall = 1495 mm / 12
Average monthly rainfall â‰ˆ 124.58 mm

So, the average monthly rainfall in the city is approximately 124.58 mm.
